Default is None meaning use the centroid.[0m [1;31mpoint: Midline point to use as the larva spatial position. Default is centroid.[0m [1;34mbend: Whether bending angle is computed as a sum of sequential segmental angles or as the angle between front and rear body vectors.[0m [1;31mfront_vector: The initial & final segment of the front body vector.[0m [1;34mrear_vector: The initial & final segment of the rear body vector.[0m [1;31mfront_body_ratio: The fraction of the body considered front, relevant for bend computation from angles.[0m [1;34muse_component_vel: Whether to use the component velocity ralative to the axis of forward motion.[0m [1;31mid: ID of the simulation. Basic Class for the Agent-based model Extends the agentpy Model class

classmethod as_function(**kwargs)[source]ÔÉÅ

Converts the model into a function that can be used with the ema_workbench library.

Parameters:

**kwargs ‚Äì Additional keyword arguments that will passed to the model in addition to the parameters.

Returns:

The model as a function that takes parameter values as keyword arguments and returns a dictionary of reporters.

Return type:

function

create_output()[source]ÔÉÅ

Generates a DataDict with dataframes of all recorded variables and reporters, which will be stored in Model.output.

end()[source]ÔÉÅ

Defines the model‚Äôs actions after the last simulation step. Can be overwritten for final calculations and reporting.

property infoÔÉÅ
report(rep_keys, value=None)[source]ÔÉÅ

Reports a new simulation result. Reporters are meant to be ‚Äòsummary statistics‚Äô or ‚Äòevaluation measures‚Äô of the simulation as a whole, and only one value can be stored per run. In comparison, variables that are recorded with Model.record() can be recorded multiple times for each time-step and object.

Parameters:

  • rep_keys (str or list of str) ‚Äì Name(s) of the reporter(s) to be documented.

  • value (int or float, optional) ‚Äì Value to be reported. The same value will be used for all rep_keys. If none is given, the values of object attributes with the same name as each rep_key will be used.

Examples

Store a reporter x with a value 42:

model.report('x', 42)

Define a custom model that stores a reporter sum_id with the sum of all agent ids at the end of the simulation:

class MyModel(ap.Model):
    def setup(self):
        agents = ap.AgentList(self, self.p.agents)
    def end(self):
        self.report('sum_id', sum(self.agents.id))

Running an experiment over different numbers of agents for this model yields the following datadict of reporters:

>>> sample = ap.sample({'agents': (1, 3)}, 3)
>>> exp = ap.Experiment(MyModel, sample)
>>> results = exp.run()
>>> results.reporters
        sum_id
run_id
0            1
1            3
2            6
run(steps=None, seed=None, display=True)[source]ÔÉÅ

Executes the simulation of the model. Can also be used to continue a partly-run simulation for a given number of additional steps.

It starts by calling Model.run_setup() and then calls Model.run_step() until the method Model.stop() is called or steps is reached. After that, Model.end() and Model.create_output() are called. The simulation results can be found in Model.output.

Parameters:

  • steps (int, optional) ‚Äì Number of (additional) steps for the simulation to run. If passed, the parameter ‚ÄòModel.p.steps‚Äô will be ignored. The simulation can still be stopped with :func:‚ÄôModel.stop‚Äô.

  • seed (int, optional) ‚Äì Seed to initialize the model‚Äôs random number generators. If none is given, the parameter ‚ÄòModel.p.seed‚Äô is used. If there is no such parameter, a random seed will be used. For a partly-run simulation, this argument will be ignored.

  • display (bool, optional) ‚Äì Whether to display simulation progress (default True).

Returns:

Recorded variables and reporters.

Return type:

DataDict

set_parameters(parameters)[source]ÔÉÅ

Adds and/or updates the parameters of the model.

setup()[source]ÔÉÅ

Defines the model‚Äôs actions before the first simulation step. Can be overwritten to initiate agents and environments.

sim_reset()[source]ÔÉÅ

Reset model to initial conditions.

sim_setup(steps=None, seed=None)[source]ÔÉÅ

Prepares time-step 0 of the simulation. Initiates (additional) steps and the two random number generators, and then calls Model.setup() and Model.update().

sim_step()[source]ÔÉÅ

Proceeds the simulation by one step, incrementing Model.t by 1 and then calling Model.step() and Model.update().

step()[source]ÔÉÅ

Defines the model‚Äôs actions during each simulation step (excluding t==0). Can be overwritten to define the models‚Äô main dynamics.

stop()[source]ÔÉÅ

Stops Model.run() during an active simulation.

update()[source]ÔÉÅ

Defines the model‚Äôs actions after each simulation step (including t==0). Can be overwritten for the recording of dynamic variables.
